summary: Implement client-side trimming of failure proto to reduce server-side truncation and wrapping. The server currently truncates oversized failures and wraps them in error responses; this feature explores doing size limiting on the client before sending to prevent this behavior, with opt-out support for custom server limits.
userImpact: Users experiencing truncated failure information due to server-side size limits could preserve complete failure details through client-side trimming.
rootCause: Server-side failure proto size limits cause truncation and wrapping of failures in error responses.
proposedFix: Implement client-side trimming of failure proto before sending to server, with configurable opt-out for users with custom server-side limits.
keyQuote: if failure proto is too large server side, they truncate it _and_ wrap in server error. See if there's something we can do client side before the failure is sent
